thread.title: Check out Lady Gaga’s swanky Super Bowl mansion in Houston (Video)
thread.title_full: Check out Lady Gaga’s swanky Super Bowl mansion in Houston (Video)

author: Paul Takahashi
title: Check out Lady Gaga’s swanky Super Bowl mansion in Houston (Video)
text: Halftime headliner Lady Gaga stayed in this Memorial-area mansion during her stay in… more Lady Gaga surely went “gaga” over her swanky Super Bowl mansion in Houston. Airbnb set up the halftime show headliner in a $10,000-a-night mansion in the Memorial area over Super Bowl weekend. Enlarge Halftime headliner Lady Gaga stayed in this Memorial-area mansion during her stay in… more Lady Gaga spent her star-studded weekend in Villa Encantado, a one-acre luxury manor in Pinewood Estates, just west of the 610 Loop and Memorial Park. The Mediterranean-style mansion — built in 2008 and designed by architect Robert Dame — spans 9,768 square feet and features five bedrooms, five-and-a-half bathrooms, a fitness center, a resort-style pool, a kitchen with a limestone fireplace, a formal dining room, a home theater and a temperature-controlled wine vault. After her electrifying Super Bowl halftime performance, Lady Gaga relaxed in a large 27-foot-by-14-foot master suite, featuring an onyx and marble-clad bathroom and expansive walk-in closets. The well-appointed home also boasts a grand Renaissance-style stone spiral staircase, beamed and domed ceilings, Cyprus wood cabinetry, limestone and walnut floors, Venetian plaster walls adorned with paintings and lush gardens and fountains. Click here to see a photo slideshow of the mansion where Lady Gaga stayed over the Super Bowl . Click on the video, courtesy of Airbnb, to take a virtual tour inside the mansion. Lady Gaga seemed to be impressed with her Super Bowl digs, posting two Instagram photos of herself staying at the Villa Encantado. In her first social media post, the platinum pop star wrote, “Houston, you are beautiful.” In the second post, she thanked Airbnb for the “gorgeous home in Houston for #SB51.”
